question: Trailers built before ____ are not required to have spring brakes.

candidates: The parking brake or the emergency brake.
question: The ____ can be used to slow the vehicle while you are driving down a hill.
When you are transporting cargo, you should inspect your cargo within the first ____ miles.
Failing to slow down and check that the tracks are clear of an approaching train can result in you losing your CDL for at least ____ for your first violation.
The parking brake valve should close when the air pressure falls into what range?
It's important that a warning signal comes on before the air pressure in the tank falls below ____.
The tractor protection valve should go from "normal" to "emergency" position when the air pressure falls into what range?
You will lose your CDL for at least ____ days if you have committed three serious traffic violations within a three-year period involving a CMV.
If you have committed two violations of an "out-of-service order" in a ten-year period, you will likely lose your CDL for what amount of time?
When you are transporting cargo, you should check your cargo is secure every ____ miles.
If you have committed three serious traffic violations within a three-year period involving a CMV, you will likely lose your CDL at least ____ days.

candidates: To protect the cargo from weather only.
To protect people (pedestrians, passengers and other civilians) from the cargo's contents if it spills.
To protect people (pedestrians, passengers and other civilians) from the cargo's contents if it spills and to protect the cargo from weather.
To help your vehicle accelerate smoothly.
question: Why should you cover your cargo during its transportation?
Placards should be what size?
What is the minimum number of days you can lose your CDL if you have committed three serious traffic violations within a three-year period involving a CMV?
When checking your hydraulic brakes, pump the brake pedal three times and make sure you hold it down for ____. The brake pedal should not depress during this time.
How many identical placards is a vehicle transporting hazardous materials required to display?
How many versions of the Class B Pre-trip inspection test are there?
As you are checking your hydraulic brakes, you should pump the brake pedal three times and then hold it for how many seconds?
In column 1 of the Hazardous Materials Table, the "I" symbol indicates ____.
The caps of your vehicle's fuel tank need to be ____.
The tractor protection valve and parking brake valve of a tractor-trailer combination vehicle should pop out at ____.

If you are always required to stop at a railroad crossing and you do not stop before driving into the crossing, you can lose your CDL for at least ____ if it is your third similar violation within a three-year period.
How do you typically control the extra gears provided by the multi-speed rear axles and auxiliary transmissions?
When transporting cargo tanks, you should stop ____ to ____ ft. before the nearest rail of a railroad.
Every ____ hours (or 150 miles, whichever comes first) you should check to ensure your cargo is secure.
Bus drivers should not carry more than ____ lbs. total of allowed hazardous materials.
While driving a combination vehicle, you should follow at least ____ second for each ____ ft. of your vehicle length.
Typically, identification numbers are ____ digit codes.

candidates: The liquid surge and the high center of gravity.
question: Why should you start, slow down and stop smoothly when driving a liquid tanker?
How many digits are identification numbers of hazardous materials?
The blind spot of a school bus can extend up to how many feet?
If the school bus is so equipped, the school bus driver should activate the bus' alternating flashing amber warning lights in accordance with state law or at least ____ before the school bus stop.
Bus drivers cannot carry more than ____ lbs. of solid Class 6 poisons.
If the outside right side flat mirror is adjusted properly, you be able to see ____ behind the bus.

candidates: Small-arms ammunition labeled ORM-D and Division 2.3 poison gases.
question: Buses must never carry ____.
Bus drivers can carry small amounts of certain hazardous materials. However, the total amount of hazardous materials should not exceed what amount?
If you are applying for a Class B CDL, you will be required ____ of the ____ versions of a pre-trip inspection in the vehicle you have brought with you for testing.

candidates: The liquid surge and the high center of gravity.
question: You should start, slow down and stop very smoothly while driving in a liquid tanker because ____.
You will lose your CDL for at least ____ if you have committed two violations of an "out-of-service order" in a ten-year period.

candidates: If you have committed a serious traffic violation.
If you use a CMV to commit a felony involving controlled substances.
If you leave the scene of an accident involving a CMV for the first time.
If you use a CMV to commit a felony involving controlled substances or if you commit an alcohol-related offense for the second time.
If you commit an alcohol-related offense for the second time.
question: When will you lose your CDL for life?
